intro: Monadenium invenustum, commonly known as the desert star, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth form and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Its unique morphology and ability to thrive in extreme conditions make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
